title: Barista
description:
**Job Title**: Barista

**Location**: New York City, NY

**Company**: Chaotic Good Cafe

**About Us**:

At Chaotic Good, we plan to combine a love of board games with the coziness of a coffeehouse focusing on specialty roasters, and bring that to the heart of the Upper West Side. We will provide a welcoming and unique space for board game enthusiasts, coffee lovers, and neighborhood locals to come together, have some fun, and savor delicious drinks, snacks, and refreshments. Finally, we will be committed to creating a vibrant and inclusive community that fosters creativity, fun, and memorable experiences.

**Position Overview**:

We are seeking dynamic and passionate baristas to be part of our first coffee team. Baristas will play a key role in providing exceptional customer service, being part of a high-quality coffee program, building relationships with roasters, and ensuring a delightful experience for our patrons.

This position will be part of Chaotic Good’s first staff lineup. The people we hire will have a unique opportunity to shape the roles, the team, and significantly contribute to the coffeehouse’s personality.

**Key Responsibilities**:

**Coffee Expertise**: Maintain the highest standards for coffee quality, consistency, and presentation. Be able to talk about coffee in a passionate way.

**Customer Service**: Deliver outstanding customer service, creating a welcoming and enjoyable experience for all customers. This includes at the register, on the floor, and behind the coffee bar.

**Inventory and Equipment Management**: Help manage and report on coffee bean inventory, supplies, and equipment to ensure seamless operations.

**Quality Assurance**: Implement and enforce health and safety regulations, and ensure a clean and organized work environment.

**Menu Development**: Collaborate with management to develop and enhance the shop’s coffee, beverage, and snack offerings.

**Community Engagemen**t: Foster a sense of community and occasionally help host events, tastings, and promotions.

**Reporting**: Share reports on sales, inventory, and customer feedback for management.

**Qualifications**:

* Prior experience in a coffee shop or cafe setting is preferred, but we are open to train.
* Knowledge of coffee drinks beyond espresso-based ones, and a passion to share and learn more. (Vietnamese coffee, Greek frappes, etc.)
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* A love of board games or role playing games, or have a willingness to learn more and share the enthusiasm with customers.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-energy environment.
* Food safety and health regulations understanding - A food handler’s license is preferred

**Benefits**:

Competitive salary - $16-$18 an hour based on experience, plus pooled tips

Yearly bonus

Opportunity to work in a unique and vibrant board game coffeehouse environment.

Ongoing training and development opportunities.

A supportive and collaborative team.

Unlimited free coffee and discounts on bags and other shop offerings.

**Career Path Growth**

Chaotic Good will strive to be a place that has transparent paths to promotion and raises, and fosters growth.

**What the cafe experience and menu will be like…**

In place of espresso-based drinks, Chaotic Good’s coffee menu will center around a large variety of specialty roasters and unique drinks to be shared with locals who can learn to make them at home. We will strive to make the best café au lait in the city using a chicory blend sourced directly from Louisiana; two or three other batch coffees will also come from the same roaster. We will also provide a rotational pour over selection focusing on both NY and minority-owned roasters. If you have a passion for specialty coffee and pour over, this is the job for you.

In addition to teas, chai, and cold brew, we will also serve unique international coffee drinks that guests can learn to make at home, such as Greek frappes, Japanese/flash-brewed iced coffee, Vietnamese coffee, and more. In the evening, we will also serve beer and wine.

Tastings events and instructional services will be provided to guests, who can also purchase bags and equipment.

Replacing the New Orleans beignet, we’ll pair the café au lait and other drinks with stroopwafels and goods from local bakeries.

As for board games, we'll have around 500 of them for guests to play! We'll also have events throughout the week, like Mahjong Mondays and multiple days featuring tabletop role playing games.

**How to Apply**:

If you are a dedicated and enthusiastic individual with a passion for coffee, board games, and community building, we'd love to hear from you. **Please send your resume to info@chaoticgoodcafe.com. Be sure to include "Barista Application" in the subject line.**

Join us at Chaotic Good and be a part of a team that brings joy, fun, and great coffee to the Upper West Side. We look forward to welcoming you to our growing family.

title: Experienced Admin & Payroll Coordinator
description:
Garden State Protection Group is seeking a detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Part-Time Admin & Payroll Coordinator. The ideal candidate for this position will have a minimum of five years relevant (payroll) experience in a similar role / an accounting background and is motivated by the opportunity to work in a small, close-knit team with a variety of responsibilities. ***Prior working experience in the office of a security company is a huge plus!!*** 

The Payroll & Admin Coordinator will generate and maintain accurate records / reporting of our company financials, employees' work hours and process the weekly payroll via PayCore software and communicate effectively with our CPA and Upper Management. Likewise, the Payroll & Admin Coordinator will also assist on the administrative side, for as needed, weekly tasks. Submit your resume and cover letter today!

*\\*\\*\\*This position is located in the Old Bridge, New Jersey area and will be a permanent, 3-days per week, Part-time role and does have the opportunity to turn into Full-Time.* Must have a reliable means of transportation.

Responsibilities:

* Process weekly payroll for employees accurately and timely
* Complete all necessary payroll reports for upper management
* Handle all tax related notices / documents
* Work with managers and employees regarding payroll-related questions and ensure all inquiries are handled efficiently and within company guidelines
* Reconcile payroll discrepancies by collecting and analyzing information
* Assist with administrative tasks as needed *(such as entering new hires, pulling weekly financial reports, maintaining office files, creating proposals, data entry for invoicing and scheduling)*

​**Qualifications:** 

**\\*\\*\\*\\* MUST have prior payroll processing experience** ***(Proficient in Paycor or ADP software)***

* Proficient in QuickBooks
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
* MUST be computer savvy
* Strong attention to detail

* Highly organized and self-motivated

* Ability to maintain integrity and confidentiality of payroll data and systems
* ***Prior working experience in the office of a security guard company is a HUGE PLUS!***

title: Registered Nurse - Medical/Surgical
description:
**Job Title:** Registrar Nurse - Med/Surg  
**Location:** New York ,NY

**Job Summary:**

The Registrar Nurse in the Medical-Surgical (Med/Surg) Unit is responsible for coordinating patient admissions, transfers, and discharges while ensuring accurate documentation and continuity of care. This role involves assessing patient needs, verifying medical records, and collaborating with the healthcare team to deliver safe and effective care. The Registrar Nurse serves as a primary point of contact for patient registration, providing essential support in a fast-paced medical-surgical environment.

**Key Responsibilities:1. Patient Admission and Registration:**

* Perform patient registration and admission duties, ensuring all required information is accurately collected and documented in the Electronic Health Record (EHR) system.
* Verify patient identity, demographics, insurance information, and obtain necessary consents and signatures.
* Conduct initial patient assessments and gather relevant medical history, ensuring accurate data entry and documentation.

**2. Coordination of Care:**

* Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care and services throughout their stay.
* Assist in scheduling diagnostic tests, procedures, and consultations as needed, and facilitate patient transfers within the hospital.
* Ensure continuity of care by providing comprehensive handoffs and updates during shift changes and patient transfers.

**3. Clinical Documentation:**

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including admission, discharge, and transfer information, in compliance with hospital policies and regulatory standards.
* Document patient assessments, observations, interventions, and responses to care in the EHR system.

**4. Discharge Planning:**

* Assist in discharge planning by coordinating with case managers, social workers, and other healthcare team members.
* Provide patients and their families with instructions and resources for post-discharge care, medications, and follow-up appointments.

**5. Patient and Family Education:**

* Educate patients and families on the care process, treatment plans, medications, and any necessary home care requirements.
* Provide information and resources to patients and families to support understanding and involvement in their care.

**6. Compliance and Safety:**

* Ensure compliance with hospital policies, procedures, and safety protocols, including infection control and patient privacy (HIPAA).
* Participate in quality improvement initiatives and contribute to a culture of safety and excellence.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off

Work Location: On the road

title: Healthcare Registrar
description:
**Job Title:** Health Care Registrar  
**Location:** New York ,NY

**Job Summary:**

The Health Care Registrar is responsible for ensuring efficient patient registration, admission, and billing processes within a healthcare facility. This role involves gathering patient information, verifying insurance, scheduling appointments, and maintaining accurate records while providing exceptional customer service to patients and their families.

**Key Responsibilities:1. Patient Registration:**

* Register patients upon arrival, ensuring all necessary information is collected and accurately entered into the Electronic Health Record (EHR) system.
* Verify patient identity and demographic information; obtain necessary consent forms and signatures.
* Ensure proper documentation and data entry for new and returning patients.

**2. Insurance Verification:**

* Verify patient insurance coverage and benefits; obtain pre-authorizations and referrals as needed.
* Communicate with insurance companies to confirm coverage, eligibility, and co-payment requirements.
* Inform patients about their financial responsibilities, including co-pays, deductibles, and out-of-pocket costs.

**3. Appointment Scheduling:**

* Schedule patient appointments, tests, and procedures in coordination with clinical staff and according to physician availability.
* Manage cancellations, rescheduling, and appointment confirmations; maintain an accurate appointment calendar.

**4. Billing and Payments:**

* Collect and process patient payments, including co-pays and outstanding balances at the time of service.
* Generate and distribute patient invoices and statements; assist with billing inquiries and resolve discrepancies.
* Work with the billing department to ensure accurate and timely submission of insurance claims.

**5. Customer Service:**

* Greet and assist patients, visitors, and families in a friendly and professional manner.
* Provide information about hospital or clinic services, directions, and general policies.
* Handle patient complaints, concerns, or questions with empathy and professionalism, escalating issues when necessary.

**6. Records Management:**

* Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records in compliance with HIPAA and other regulatory standards.
* Ensure all patient documentation is completed, scanned, and properly stored in the EHR system.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Cell phone reimbursement
* Commuter assistance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Work Location: On the road

title: Registered Nurse (RN) - Primary Care - Peekskill, NY
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a Full Time Registered Nurse to join its busy team at our Peekskill, NY location.

A Registered Nurse renders professional nursing care to patients, within an assigned unit or authorized community health center site, in support of medical care as directed by the medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Sun River Community Health. In addition, this position will perform duties assigned on as needed basis.

Essential duties and responsibilities of a Registered Nurse:

* Interviews patients for health history, including history of current complaint, and past and present use of medication utilizing patient identifies; document patient charts (must be time stamped and/or initialed)
* Maintains patient medical record and charts the following: nursing observation; vital signs; reactions to test, i.e., PPD results, in-house testing, and other pertinent information
* Prepares equipment and assists physician during treatments and examinations of patients.
* Initiates follow-up, as necessary. Instruct patients on healthcare issues, as indicated by physician, diagnosis and/or inquiries by patient.
* Assesses and triages patients as they present, either by telephone or in person.
* Demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and provide appropriate care.
* Attends mandated training and keeps up to date on all nursing procedures including relevant procedures.

Minimum Education Requirement:

* Associates Degree

Preferred Education Requirement:

* Bachelors Degree

Minimum Work Related Experience:

* 1 - 4 years of experience

Minimum Requirement for Licensure/ Certification/Registration:

* Registered Nurse - NYS
* CPR Certification
* Infection Control Certification

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45.00 - $53.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

description:

**RETAIL SALES CONSULTANT, MWT | AT&T AUTHORIZED RETAILER**

**CATEGORY:** AT&T Retail Store - **Hiring Immediately**

**COMPENSATION RANGE\\*\\***: $42,109 - $104,243

**POSITION:** Retail Sales Associate

**BENEFITS:** Blue Cross Blue Shield**,** Delta Dental Plan, Vision & Life Insurance, Vacation Pay, Short- & Long-Term Disability and 401K!

**FULL-TIME/PART-TIME:** Full-Time Retail Sales Associate

**PLEASE NOTE: There is a required assessment that must be completed before moving forward with an interview. (Link below)**

***It’s time to have a career in the most expansive and evolving industry representing a leader in the communications industry!***

***Our stores have thousands of local residents coming in to check on their services, upgrade their cell phones, choose different packages, buy the latest new cell phones, purchase accessories, and change their home services over to the award-winning Direct TV. Our stores are filled with activity and opportunity to take your income to the next level! The retail sales stores you will work in are beautifully designed that will make you feel proud of your work environment.***

***You will receive a flexible full-time schedule designed to give you work-life harmony while also providing you the best times to interact with our customers and earn the money you deserve!***

***Who is MWT?***

We are Millennium Wireless Technology, AT&T’s Premier Authorized Retailer. We have been serving people in our communities for over 25 years! We started with one location and currently operate 19 locations in Michigan, 11 locations in Wisconsin, 3 Locations in New York, 4 Locations in New Jersey and 12 Locations in Illinois. With 49 locations we are excited to say our vision to become the #1 AT&T Authorized Retailer in the Greater Lakes Region has come true.

*We are a family-owned business who value our employees and treat everyone like Family. Our employees are a diverse group of caring, fun professionals who all strive to make our customers feel like neighbors and not a number. We take great pride in the services we offer and love providing the communications people want and need.*

**Why Should you be a Retail Sales Associate with us?**

Working here means you'll get what you expect in a retail sales career like a great base pay, an unlimited bonus opportunity, discounts on our products and services, great health benefits, dental, vision and disability insurance, PTO and 401(k).

But we can agree that money isn't everything! So, with our retail sales position you'll get a balanced work schedule, a family atmosphere; leaders who genuinely care about your personal and professional goals, who actively listen to your feedback, who implement your great ideas, who live by our core values, who lead by example and who honor their word.

Our retail sales stores are clean, well-kept, stocked with all the latest gadgets in wireless technology and state of the art computerized point of sale and activation systems. Most stores are new or freshly remodeled. We also offer break rooms, chilled bottled water, refrigerators, microwaves and dining areas for your convenience.

Lastly, it’s all about our people. They are a diverse group of caring, fun, and respectful sales professionals. They genuinely care about the customer, the company and most of all each other. If you are looking for an amazing retail sales career MWT is the place to be.

***So, what can you bring to us as a Retail Sales Associate?***

· A passion for helping people

· A “gut-feeling” that you believe you deserve more than what you are earning today

· GRIT – you have the discipline to go beyond the obstacle to achieve your goals

· You have a dynamic personality! Your positive energy fuels others!

· A desire to have the opportunity to grow professionally, should you choose a path into leadership, one day managing your own store.

**Minimum Requirements:**

· High School Diploma or Equivalent; BS/BA Preferred

· Minimum of 1 year of proven work history & success in Retail Sales or business that directly deals with customers

· Physical Capacity: The ability to work 40+ hours each week consistently, to travel to local events, setup and tear down, stand on your feet all day, etc.

**EEO STATEMENT**

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law**.**

title: Medical Administrative Assistant
description:
**Job Title:** Medical Administrative Assistant  
**Location:** New York ,NY

**Job Summary:**

The Medical Administrative Assistant is responsible for providing administrative support to healthcare providers and ensuring smooth operations within a medical office or clinic. This role involves patient interaction, managing appointments, maintaining medical records, and assisting with billing and insurance tasks, while maintaining a professional and welcoming environment.

**Key Responsibilities:1. Patient Coordination:**

* Greet and register patients upon arrival; verify patient information and insurance details.
* Schedule patient appointments, follow-up visits, and coordinate referrals to specialists.
* Answer phone calls, respond to patient inquiries, and manage communication with patients and other healthcare providers.

**2. Records Management:**

* Maintain and update patient medical records and charts in the Electronic Health Record (EHR) system.
* Ensure all patient information is accurate, up-to-date, and complies with HIPAA regulations.
* Prepare and organize patient files for upcoming appointments, and assist with documentation.

**3. Billing and Insurance:**

* Assist with medical billing and coding for insurance claims, process payments, and manage accounts receivable.
* Verify insurance coverage, obtain pre-authorizations, and handle billing inquiries from patients or insurance companies.
* Prepare and submit insurance claims and follow up on unpaid claims.

**4. Office Administration:**

* Manage office supplies, maintain inventory, and order necessary items.
* Coordinate office communications, including faxing, mailing, and emailing documents.
* Assist in organizing and maintaining a clean and orderly office environment.

**5. Support to Healthcare Providers:**

* Assist healthcare providers with administrative tasks, such as preparing documents, handling correspondence, and managing schedules.
* Prepare examination rooms by ensuring they are clean, stocked, and organized.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $20.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: On the road

title: Retail Sales Consultant, MWT| AT&T Authorized Retailer -Brooklyn, NY (Liberty Ave) Bilingual/Spanish
description:
**~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~**  
**\\*FLUENCY IN SPANISH IS REQUIRED\\***  
**~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~**

**RETAIL SALES CONSULTANT, MWT | AT&T AUTHORIZED RETAILER**

**CATEGORY:** AT&T Retail Store - **Hiring Immediately**

**COMPENSATION RANGE\\*\\***: $42,109 - $104,243

**COMMISSION STRUCTURE:** Unlimited Commission Potential

**POSITION:** Retail Sales Associate

**BENEFITS:** Blue Cross Blue Shield**,** Delta Dental Plan, Vision & Life Insurance, Vacation Pay, Short- & Long-Term Disability and 401K!

**FULL-TIME/PART-TIME:** Full-Time Retail Sales Associate

**PLEASE NOTE: There is a required assessment that must be completed before moving forward with an interview. (Link below)**

***It’s time to have a career in the most expansive and evolving industry representing a leader in the communications industry!***

***Our stores have thousands of local residents coming in to check on their services, upgrade their cell phones, choose different packages, buy the latest new cell phones, purchase accessories, and change their home services over to the award-winning Direct TV. Our stores are filled with activity and opportunity to take your income to the next level! The retail sales stores you will work in are beautifully designed that will make you feel proud of your work environment.***

***You will receive a flexible full-time schedule designed to give you work-life harmony while also providing you the best times to interact with our customers and earn the money you deserve!***

***Who is MWT?***

We are Millennium Wireless Technology, AT&T’s Premier Authorized Retailer. We have been serving people in our communities for over 25 years! We started with one location and currently operate 19 locations in Michigan, 11 locations in Wisconsin, 3 Locations in New York, 4 Locations in New Jersey and 12 Locations in Illinois. With 49 locations we are excited to say our vision to become the #1 AT&T Authorized Retailer in the Greater Lakes Region has come true.

*We are a family-owned business who value our employees and treat everyone like Family. Our employees are a diverse group of caring, fun professionals who all strive to make our customers feel like neighbors and not a number. We take great pride in the services we offer and love providing the communications people want and need.*

**Why Should you be a Retail Sales Associate with us?**

Working here means you'll get what you expect in a retail sales career like a great base pay, an unlimited bonus opportunity, discounts on our products and services, great health benefits, dental, vision and disability insurance, PTO and 401(k).

But we can agree that money isn't everything! So, with our retail sales position you'll get a balanced work schedule, a family atmosphere; leaders who genuinely care about your personal and professional goals, who actively listen to your feedback, who implement your great ideas, who live by our core values, who lead by example and who honor their word.

Our retail sales stores are clean, well-kept, stocked with all the latest gadgets in wireless technology and state of the art computerized point of sale and activation systems. Most stores are new or freshly remodeled. We also offer break rooms, chilled bottled water, refrigerators, microwaves and dining areas for your convenience.

Lastly, it’s all about our people. They are a diverse group of caring, fun, and respectful sales professionals. They genuinely care about the customer, the company and most of all each other. If you are looking for an amazing retail sales career MWT is the place to be.

***So, what can you bring to us as a Retail Sales Associate?***

· A passion for helping people

· A “gut-feeling” that you believe you deserve more than what you are earning today

· GRIT – you have the discipline to go beyond the obstacle to achieve your goals

· You have a dynamic personality! Your positive energy fuels others!

· A desire to have the opportunity to grow professionally, should you choose a path into leadership, one day managing your own store.

**Minimum Requirements:**

· High School Diploma or Equivalent; BS/BA Preferred

· Minimum of 1 year of proven work history & success in Retail Sales or business that directly deals with customers

· Physical Capacity: The ability to work 40+ hours each week consistently, to travel to local events, setup and tear down, stand on your feet all day, etc.

**EEO STATEMENT**

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law**.**

**COMPANY INTRO**

We would also like to invite you to watch a quick Intro to our company. This will explain our pay structure and how our interviewing process works.

https://youtu.be/rjT4dCqvnkg

**Link to complete assessment -** https://www.ondemandassessment.com/link/index/JB-6B15F076E?u=162574

**At AT&T, the safety of our employees and customers remains our top priority. We are committed to following all protective and safe-distancing guidelines required by local & state authorities in response to COVID-19.**

Updated 9/11/2024.

title: Strategic Account Executive, Financial Services
description:
Reporting to the VP of Sales, Financial Services, the Strategic Account Executive is a self-driven, results-oriented, sales professional with a positive outlook able to carry out professional sales activities to secure sales of our suite of products. Our clients are some of the most influential Financial Institutions, Investment Banks, and Private Equity firms in the world.


If you have excellent Sales skills, strong research and communication skills and are great at networking, we would like to talk. Six+ years of hunting Sales experience selling software is a must; experience selling feeds and data is a plus. If you are an experienced B2B Enterprise Sales Solutions with experience selling into the Financial Institutions, Investment Banks, and insurance companies we would like to talk to you.

**Principle Responsibilities**

* Lead the entire sales process; identify, qualify, and close sales pipeline with large institutional and enterprise accounts
* Secure demonstrations to senior decision makers within an organization
* Conduct customer demos, lead detailed technical sales
* Utilize and maintain an organized CRM to help with sales forecasting accuracy and consistency
* Respond to and follow up sales enquiries in a timely manner
* Close deals and see the process through to invoicing of contract value
* Align and drive sales initiatives with company goals
* Achieve monthly sales targets on a cumulative basis

**Qualifications and Experience**

* 6+ years sales experience with consistent success meeting or exceeding sales objectives selling software products and technical solutions into the enterprise market.
* Experience working with and selling into Investment Banks, Financial Institutions, and Insurance Companies or PE/Hedge Fund owners/managers and also CTOs, is a strong plus
* Experience building pipeline through outbound
* A track record in securing new logos, with experience building pipeline through outbound
* A familiarity with solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills, organization and contact management capabilities.
* Ability to interact from C-Suite to Associate level required
* Experience with SaaS and fintech products a strong plus
* Hard working with a positive attitude, strong work ethic, ability to work under pressure and independently
* Self-motivated and able to prove this based on previous performance
* Motivated by the desire to constantly learn in a changing environment and actively contribute to a dynamic team structure
* Excels at networking, setting up meetings and closing deals

 ***Altrata is actively committed to promoting, fostering, and nurturing a diverse and inclusive environment, and all applicants will receive equal consideration regardless of race, sex, religion, color, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We recognize that these types of statements appear often in job descriptions. Altrata eally and truly means it.***

title: Registered Nurse (RN) - Primary Care Outpatient - Peekskill (Part-Time)
description:
Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester County. Sun River Health is currently seeking a Full Time Registered Nurse to join its busy team at our Peekskill, NY location.

A Registered Nurse renders professional nursing care to patients, within an assigned unit or authorized community health center site, in support of medical care as directed by the medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Sun River Community Health. In addition, this position will perform duties assigned on as needed basis.

Essential duties and responsibilities of a Registered Nurse:

* Interviews patients for health history, including history of current complaint, and past and present use of medication utilizing patient identifies; document patient charts (must be time stamped and/or initialed)
* Maintains patient medical record and charts the following: nursing observation; vital signs; reactions to test, i.e., PPD results, in-house testing, and other pertinent information
* Prepares equipment and assists physician during treatments and examinations of patients.
* Initiates follow-up, as necessary. Instruct patients on healthcare issues, as indicated by physician, diagnosis and/or inquiries by patient.
* Assesses and triages patients as they present, either by telephone or in person.
* Demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and provide appropriate care.
* Attends mandated training and keeps up to date on all nursing procedures including relevant procedures.

Minimum Education Requirement:

* Associates Degree

Preferred Education Requirement:

* Bachelors Degree

Minimum Work Related Experience:

* 1 - 4 years of experience

Minimum Requirement for Licensure/ Certification/Registration:

* Registered Nurse - NYS
* CPR Certification
* Infection Control Certification

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.

Pay: $45.00 - $53.00 per hour

title: Full Time Assistant Manager 805
description:
**Job Title: Senior Assistant Manager**

**Reports To: Store Manager**

**Position Summary:**

The Senior Assistant Manager is responsible for making volume and profits for the assigned store through effective management of store staff and execution of company programs, policies, and procedures. He or she gains the experience needed to progress to the next level of responsibility.

**Essential Job Responsibilities:**

**A. Sales**

* Adheres to all corporate Sales and Customer Service programs and ensures customer satisfaction.
* Effectively motivates others to meet and exceed sales plans and communicates financial goals to other members of store management.
* Analyzes sales trends by using all available resources and makes recommendations to the Store Manager for increasing sales.
* Actively supports the store in complying with and conducting contests and promotions.

**B. Human Resources**

* Ensures proper staffing by proactively recruiting and effectively utilizing the STARS process for interviewing and retaining Associates.
* Provides for Associate development through disciplined use of store training programs, thus encouraging internal promotions to support company growth.
* Effectively motivates Associates to achieve position requirements and provides regular feedback on performance, including constructive and disciplinary conversations, as necessary.
* Ensures that store-level Associate Performance Appraisals are performed in a timely manner.
* Follows appropriate protocol for Associate Relations issues.

**C. Operations**

* Maintains and controls all expenses to ensure store profitability. Makes all Associates partner in cost savings measures.
* Protects all corporate assets by following Loss Prevention guidelines.
* Ensures efficient use of payroll dollars by utilizing effective scheduling practices.
* Completes, maintains, and submits all required company paperwork on a timely basis.
* Ensures adherence to all company policies and procedures.
* Provides for a well maintained, clean, and organized store to support efficient operations and a pleasant shopping environment.

**D. Merchandising and Marketing**

* Ensures that all aspects of inventory integrity occur (Receiving and Returns, Price Changes, Cycle counts, and Rush Ordering).
* Effectively merchandises store in accordance with corporate communications.
* Strives to continually increase personal product knowledge and that of all store Associates.
* Actively shops competition to maintain awareness of strategies, developments, and opportunities.
* Ensures that the store is in stock on key titles and communicates "stock outs".

**E. Management**

* Projects the role of the Store Manager as the senior member of the management team.
* Establishes a positive, professional, sales and profit-oriented atmosphere.
* Leads by setting the appropriate example.
* Shows fairness and good judgment in decision-making and delegation of responsibilities.
* Exhibits a sense of awareness, urgency, and organization.
* Responsible for analyzing financial reports on a monthly basis to develop an action plan for sales and profit maximization.
* Demonstrates the ability to plan, organize, delegate, execute, and follow up.
* Assists District and Regional Manager with special projects.
* Communicates regularly with the Store Manager and the store Associates to provide updates on all relevant aspects of the business.
* Has a desire for advancement.

**Qualifications**:

* Candidate must possess one to two years of prior management experience, retail is preferred.
* The candidate must possess professional and leadership skills and attributes.
* The candidate must be available for a minimum of 40 hours per week.

\\*Note that salary will be based on candidates experience

Pay: $34,000.00 per year

title: Nurse Manager (RN) - Primary Care Outpatient - Peekskill
description:
**Nurse Manager (RN) - Primary Care at The Jeannette J. Phillips Community Health Center, Peekskill NY**

**\\*\\*\\*\\*\\*\\* $2700 Sign-On-Bonus- Terms and Conditions Apply\\*\\*\\*\\***

Sun River Health provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative and behavioral health services to all who see it, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. Sun River Health is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving communities in Suffolk, Rockland, Orange, Dutchess, Ulster, Sullivan, Columbia and Westchester. We currently have the need for a full-time Nurse Manager to support our busy Peekskill, NY location.

A Nurse Manager renders professional nursing care to patients, within an assigned unit or authorized community health center site, in support of medical care as directed by the medical staff and pursuant to the objectives and policies of the Hudson River Community Health, participates in the interview process, make hiring decisions, train staff on policies and procedures, conduct performance reviews, and follow progressive discipline guidelines as needed and is responsible for conducting monthly quality health standard audits of assigned units. Performs other duties as assigned on as needed basis.

Essential Duties and Job Responsibilities:

* Provide patient education according to patient needs and preferences and document in medical record
* Attend mandated training and demonstrate competence on all nursing procedures, including relevant lab procedures
* Manage/lead the clinical staff (nurses, medical and clinical assistants, laboratory staff, and, and Patient Navigators), including but not limited to recruitment and hiring, performance reviews, onboarding, training and competencies, assignments, and work flow
* Ensure that all clinical staff (nurses, medical and clinical assistants, laboratory staff, and, and Patient Navigators) adhere to and understand the work flows, documentation requirements in EHR according to HRHCARE quality standards
* Review all site quality data monthly and identify, lead and develop strategies for improvement in collaboration with the site leadership team, to promote quality, safety and patient satisfaction
* Ensure that site champions are identified for the core quality initiatives and core systems including workflow and documentation are understood and executed.
* Ensure that HRHCare standard procedures and work flows are implemented and followed, including but not limited to: medication management, pre-visit planning, team huddles, accurate and timely completion of Nursing Quality Logs, exam room readiness, ordering and storing of supplies and equipment
* Responsible for oversight of laboratory operations and continuous review of In-House Lab Tests Quality Control and Maintenance Logs
* Ensure that the quality of care is assessed and improved through regular record audits
* In collaboration with the rest of the site leadership team, develop and lead initiatives to promote and improve quality, safety and patient satisfaction
* Participate in monthly leadership and staff meetings
* Demonstrate knowledge of decontamination and sterilization processes, and perform regular review of D & S Processing and Maintenance Logs (note: in sites with dental services, dentist performs more intensive review of logs, but NM needs to be familiar with and shares responsibility for compliance with standards)
* Conduct monthly component meetings with all clinical support team and review the priority issues of the organization including quality, safety and patient satisfaction including any organizational updates or initiatives
* Complete annual evaluations of clinical support team
* Monitor and facilitate patient follow-up as needed, including test results and missed appointments.
* Demonstrate knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span, and provide age- appropriate and culturally sensitive care, including use of medical interpreters as indicated
* Perform direct patient care duties of an RN: interview patients for health history, prepare equipment and assist practitioner during examination and treatment of patients, document in patient medical record according to HRHCare standard, assess and triage patients as needed

Minimum Education Requirement: Bachelors Degree (BSN)

Minimum Work-Related Experience: 3 - 5 years

Minimum Licensure Requirement: Licensed Registered Nurse

NYS; CPR Certification; Infection Control Certification

Sun River Health is a network of over 40 Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) providing primary, dental, pediatric, OB-GYN, and behavioral health care to over 245,000 patients annually. With a dedicated staff of 2,000 doctors, nurses, and health care professionals, we pride ourselves on delivering high-quality, affordable care to those who need it most. Sun River Health started in 1975 when four African American mothers spearheaded efforts to open our first health center in Peekskill, New York to deliver accessible, high-quality, affordable services to patients in need no matter their race, religion, income, or insurance status. Today, after 45 years of service, Sun River Health is still delivering on that promise to communities across the Hudson Valley, New York City, and Long Island.

title: Billing Coordinator
description:
**Job Summary**  
The Billing Coordinator will be responsible for managing and overseeing the billing processes for home care services, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards. This role involves using various systems, including EVV (Electronic Visit Verification), HHAeXchange, CareBridge Portal, and TriZetto Portal, to handle billing functions efficiently.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Billing Management:** Process, review, and submit claims for home care services using EVV, HHAEXCHANGE, CAREBRIDGE PORTAL, and TRIZETTO PORTAL.
* **Claims Processing:** Ensure accurate and timely submission of claims to insurance companies and other payers. Address and resolve any claim denials or rejections.
* **Verification & Reconciliation:** Verify the accuracy of service documentation and reconcile billing discrepancies. Confirm that all services provided are billed correctly and in compliance with company policies and payer requirements.
* **Customer Service:** Serve as the primary point of contact for billing inquiries from clients, caregivers, and insurance companies. Provide clear and prompt resolution to any billing-related issues.
* **Compliance:** Maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant billing regulations, payer requirements, and industry best practices. Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
* **Reporting:** Generate and analyze billing reports to track key performance indicators, identify trends, and support financial planning. Provide regular updates to management on billing status and issues.
* **System Maintenance:** Ensure the accurate entry and maintenance of data in billing systems. Perform system updates and troubleshooting as needed.
* **Training & Support:** Assist in training new staff on billing procedures and system usage. Provide ongoing support to team members as needed.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Minimum of 3 years of experience in billing within a home care setting. Proficiency with EVV, HHAEXCHANGE, CAREBRIDGE PORTAL, and TRIZETTO PORTAL is required.
* **Knowledge:** Strong understanding of home care billing practices, payer requirements, and electronic billing systems.
* **Skills:** Excellent attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and the ability to handle complex billing issues. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
* **Communication:** Effective verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact professionally with clients, caregivers, and insurance representatives.
* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent; relevant certifications or further education in medical billing and coding is a plus.

**What We Offer:**

* Competitive salary
* Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance
* Paid time off and holidays
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
* A supportive and collaborative work environment

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $21.63 - $22.76 per hour

Expected hours: 20 per week

Experience:

* Home care: 2 years (Required)
* Home & community care: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Jersey City, NJ 07302 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Jersey City, NJ 07302: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Manager, Implementation
description:
ADP is hiring a **Manager, Implementation Delivery for NAS Next Gen HCM**


* Are you ready to grow your career and lead a team at an established, respected, global company?
* Are you empathic to client needs, the people you lead, and internal partners to drive success?
* Are you looking for an inclusive environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging?

If so, this may be an opportunity for you. Read on and decide for yourself.
  

  

In this role, you will lead a team of approximately 10-12 to deliver quality HCM implementations that exceed client expectations. In addition, you will have matrix responsibility for project teams on client implementation projects in delivering the Next Gen HCM solution. The *Manager, Implementation* is responsible for managing the Project consultant’s ability to deliver client requirements within project deadlines and budget. Reporting directly to the Implementation Director, this role is a key part of the Implementation organization and will be required to build relationships with internal partners to drive and support best practice, continuous improvement, and standard work across the team. You and your team carry the weight of ADP's service reputation and client satisfaction in your hands.
  

  

Every day, you'll leverage your project management and leadership expertise to assist in establishing the direction of your team's daily activities, coaching and developing your team members, creating an overall productive and enjoyable working environment for your team, and managing and resolving client escalations.
  

  

To thrive in this role, you must be comfortable working in a fast paced, deadline-driven environment. You have a way with clients and the people that you lead that builds rapport, establishes trust, and shines with professionalism. Pace should not scare you. We also have a healthy dose of fun. Not only can you find a career here but friendships that last in a company that values inclusion.
  

  

**A little about ADP:** We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the ***OneTen*** coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans within ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI\\_Videos


Ready to #MakeYourMark? **Apply now!**  

  

**To learn more about Client Services at ADP,****watch here:** https://adp.careers/Client\\_Services\\_Videos


**Here's what you can expect on a typical day:**


* **Be a Leader.** You will provide overall direction, prioritize critical issues, and support your team to ensure that work is completed accurately and with quality according to scheduled deadlines, priorities, and overall goals. You will serve as a resource for your team, based on a solid working knowledge of the team's responsibilities and each associate's development plan. You'll also participate in task forces, strategic initiatives, stretch assignments, and collaboration opportunities with other ADP business units.
* **Mentor and Train.** You will motivate associates while providing continuous feedback on performance and coaching. You will help develop your team members' careers and coordinate any additional training as needed with leadership support.
* **Represent ADP.** You will represent ADP and be responsible for a portfolio of client engagements and the implementation execution leveraging our standard, client-centric approach with high quality results. You'll work as a business partner with the Global Product Team, Client Success, Client Services and Sales to resolve issues and achieve project goals. Plus, you will conduct regular project reviews to inspect standard work adherence, client satisfaction and overall project health. You also partner with Sales team in pre-sales efforts to provide input on implementation methodology and project timelines.
* **Flex and Adapt.** You thrive in a structured environment where you set priorities, organize your day, multi-task, change direction, and provide prompt follow-up. You're a problem solver who can find an answer, or a solution, for time-sensitive issues and meet deadlines. You take the initiative to seek answers, solutions, and positive outcomes for both the client and ADP.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO:** Responsibilities


**Business Management:**


* Delivers against a defined set of performance standards that contribute to the results of the Delivery Team and NAS.
* These performance standards include but are not limited to Starts Revenue, Setup revenue, and NPS Scores.
* Executes on continuous improvement initiatives across the Delivery Team. Acts as a change leader.
* Optimizes resources and staffing in team for efficiency and maximum productivity and utilization.
* Collaborates with other Delivery Managers to support consistency, resource sharing and optimization to achieve performance results and metrics.

**Client Management:**


* Responsible for a portfolio of client engagements and aligns team on implementation execution leveraging the NAS standard client-centric approach with high quality results.
* Manage client expectations and monitors client deliverables.
* Works as a business partner with Client Engagement Leader to resolve issues and achieve project goal.
* Works with Client Engagement Leader and Service Leaders to validate Client Business Issues have been addressed in the implementation and the client has successfully transitioned to ongoing service.
* Serves as a First and Second Tier of escalation contact for Clients.
* Conducts regular project reviews with HCM PMs and Implementation Consultants to inspect standard work adherence, client satisfaction and overall project health.

**Associate Management:**


* Expected to build strong relationship with peer teams as collaboration and cross teamwork efforts are key to the organization's overall success.
* Manage all HR related activities for the team (staffing, development, mentoring, training)
* Works with peers and Work Force Planning Office to assign resources to projects in accordance with requirements of those projects for certain skills and capabilities as well as the development requirements of the team on Domain Expertise.
* Leads implementation teams to ensure implementations are accomplished on-time and with high degree of quality across the portfolio.
* Manages and coaches team; understands how to motivate to inspire results.
  

  

**TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE:**Required Qualifications


* At least **three years** of experience in HCM Implementations, Consulting, Payroll or HR
* At least **one year** of project, team lead or people leadership experience
* Ability to travel up to 15%
* Bachelor’s degree

**BONUS POINTS FOR THESE:**Preferred Qualifications


* Experience and knowledge of Change Management methodology in client readiness programs and enterprise-wide communications strategy
* Proficiency and in-depth knowledge ADP HCM products
* Full professional proficiency in Spanish or French, written and verbal
* Experience leading teams, especially those in a virtual / hybrid environment
* Ability to set high standards of performance for self and others for delivering results (takes bold action to strengthen the business results)

**BONUS POINTS FOR THESE:**Preferred Qualifications


* Experience and knowledge of Change Management methodology in client readiness programs and enterprise-wide communications strategy
* Proficiency and in-depth knowledge ADP HCM products
* Full professional proficiency in Spanish or French, written and verbal
* Experience leading teams, especially those in a virtual / hybrid environment
* Ability to set high standards of performance for self and others for delivering results (takes bold action to strengthen the business results)

**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.


**Ethics at ADP:** ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. title: Associate District Manager
description:
ADP is hiring a **Sales Representative, Small Business Services.**


* *Are you ready to build a rewarding future? Uncapped commissions, lavish incentive trips, and career advancement are some of the ways.*
* *Do you want to join a Fortune 250 company with industry-leading sales training and the latest sales technology to help you achieve success**?*
* *Are you looking to join a fast-paced, inclusive environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging?*

If so, this may be the opportunity you've been searching for. Read on and decide for yourself.


In this role, you will work within a defined geographic territory that targets clients and prospects with 1-49 employees. You will identify and sign new clients for payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and more and sell additional solutions to existing clients. Daily, you will cultivate relationships, set appointments, gather leads from established business partners, assess client or prospect needs to present the best ADP solutions, and spend your time in the field closing business. Don't worry if you have no prior sales experience; we are known for our high-quality sales training and will teach you how to use the latest sales technology to set you up for success.


Integrity, resilience, positivity, and a "refuse to lose" attitude are must-haves in this job. As with any role in sales, you will experience ebbs and flows. However, challenges should ignite your determination and invigorate you to thrive, not weigh you down. In return, you'll be rewarded with uncapped commissions, incentive trips, and opportunities to advance your career in a fun and friendly environment - all while gaining serious credibility as part of an industry-leading sales team in a stable and highly respected tech company.


**A little about ADP:** We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the ***OneTen*** coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans within ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI\\_Videos.


Ready to #MakeYourMark? **Apply now!**


**To learn more about Sales at ADP**, watch here: http://adp.careers/Sales\\_Videos


**What you'll do:** *Responsibilities*


* **Grow Our Business While Growing Yours.** You will work independently and collaboratively as part of various teams within your assigned geography to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals.
* **Turn Prospects into Loyal Clients and Raving Fans.** You will implement a sales strategy targeted to decision-makers and business owners to build a network and capture new business.
* **Deepen** **Relationships Across the ADP Family.** In addition to selling cloud-based human resources solutions, you will strategically cultivate additional business within existing accounts. But it's not all business; you will make life-long friendships here.
* **Collaborate** **Daily.** You will serve as a trusted advisor, partner, and ADP ambassador to your clients, internal partners, and overall network while demonstrating grace under pressure and the highest ethical standards.

**TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE****:** *Required Qualifications*


* **Positive Self-Starter****.** You have an upbeat, persistent style and the ability to cold call without fear of rejection, manage your time well, and can present your ideas in a clear professional manner on paper, in-person, and over the phone.
* **Agile Solution Seeker****.** You're a problem solver who can find an answer, or a solution, even in times of fast-paced change.
* **Continuous Learner****.** You're always learning, growing, and questioning how things were done in the past to make them even better.

A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. Other acceptable experiences could include:
* One to two years of prior work experience or internships in Retail, Marketing, Business Development, Food Service, Insurance Sales, or another relevant industry, OR
* Military experience where skills including teamwork, adaptability, organization, and follow-through will help you build team and client relationships, identify solutions, and achieve success.

**Bonus points for these:** *Preferred Qualifications*


* Prior quota-carrying experience
* Ability to successfully build a network and effectively use social media for sales

**YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN:**
* **Be yourself** in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
* **Belong** by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.
* **Grow your career** in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.
* **Continuously learn** through ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities.
* **Be your healthiest.** Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.
* **Balance work and life.** Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life.
* **Focus on your mental health and well-being.** We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.
* **Join a company committed to giving back** and generating a lasting, positive impact upon the communities in which we work and live.
* **Get paid to pay it forward.** Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.

What are you waiting for? **Apply today!**

Base salary offers for this position may vary based on factors such as location, skills, and relevant experience. Some positions may include additional compensation in the form of bonus, equity or commissions. We offer the following benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Matched Retirement Savings, Wellness Program, Short-and Long-Term Disability, Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Paid Volunteer Time Off, and more. The compensation for this role is $34,800.00 - $75,100.00 / Year

title: Advisor
description:
**CSI Group** **is a fast growing, family owned, Wall, NJ based CPA firm focusing on individuals and families, providing Individual Income Tax Preparation, Tax Planning, Trust & Estate Tax Preparation, Trust, Will & Estate Planning, and Retirement and Financial planning. CSI group has over 20 locations in New Jersey, New York, and Florida. CSI Group is aggressively expanding and quickly gaining market share in New Jersey, and has become a household name in the state. The company is looking for career minded talent that is excited about participating and being a part of the rapid growth of the company. CSI Group is very eager to promote and hire from within the company, making it the perfect place for an individual who seeks a fast track to a highly successful career path.**

 **Job Summary:**



The Tax and Financial Services Advisor is responsible for providing comprehensive financial planning and tax advisory services to clients. This role involves analyzing clients' financial situations, developing strategies to meet their financial goals, ensuring compliance with tax laws, and maximizing tax efficiency. The advisor will work closely with clients to build long-term relationships based on trust, professionalism, and excellent service.

 **Key Responsibilities:**



* **Financial Planning and Advisory:**
	+ Assess clients' overall financial situation, including income, expenses, savings, investments, and retirement goals.
	+ Develop personalized financial plans tailored to clients' specific needs and goals.
	+ Provide investment advice, retirement planning, and wealth management services.
	+ Monitor clients’ financial status and adjust plans as necessary.
* **Tax Planning and Compliance:**
	+ Advise clients on tax-related matters, including income tax, estate tax, capital gains tax, and other applicable taxes.
	+ Prepare and review tax returns for individuals, businesses, and other entities.
	+ Identify tax-saving opportunities and ensure clients take advantage of tax deductions and credits.
	+ Stay up-to-date with changes in tax laws and regulations to provide accurate and timely advice.
	+ Assist clients with tax audits and represent them before tax authorities if needed.
* **Client Relationship Management:**
	+ Build and maintain strong relationships with clients through regular communication and personalized service.
	+ Conduct client meetings to review financial status, discuss strategies, and update plans.
	+ Respond promptly to client inquiries and provide ongoing support and advice.
* **Research and Analysis:**
	+ Conduct thorough research on market trends, financial products, and tax laws to provide informed advice.
	+ Analyze complex financial and tax data to identify trends and opportunities for clients.
* **Compliance and Reporting:**
	+ Ensure all financial and tax advisory activities comply with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.
	+ Maintain accurate and confidential client records and documentation.
	+ Prepare reports and documentation for internal and external audits.
  

  



**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFP, CFA) is preferred.
* Proven experience in tax preparation, financial planning, or a related field.
* Strong understanding of tax laws, financial regulations, and investment strategies.
* Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail.
* Proficient in financial planning software and tools.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple client accounts.
* High ethical standards and a commitment to maintaining client confidentiality.

title: Pressure Washing Technician
description:
**Kept Companies** is the largest self-performing commercial cleaning and maintenance company in the nation. With nine leading brands and over 100 locations nationwide servicing industries including restaurant, solar, retail, transportation and supermarket, Kept Companies is the leading provider of commercial fleet washing, retail equipment refurbishing and sales, refrigeration, hood, coil and solar panel cleaning and parking lot services in the nation.

  

We have immediate openings for **Pressure Washer Technicians** (Field) in your area. ***Must be able to work evenings and weekends if necessary.***

  

The Service Technician will be responsible for using pressure washing and other equipment to clean multiple types of surfaces such as:


* Tractors and trailers and other types of vehicles.
* Sidewalks and buildings.
* Windows

  



This is a field position (not inside) and requires working in most weather conditions.



A background check will be completed.

  

**Qualifications:**



Must be at least 21 years of age.



High School Diploma or equivalent  

Valid Driver’s License with clean driving record  

DOT medical card (preferred)  

Previous Experience in detailing or related field (preferred)  

Knowledge of detailing techniques, buffing, and/or custodial work.  

Attention to detail and ability to work efficiently.  

Strong Customer service skills to interact with clients in a professional manner.  

Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.  

Ability to operate smart phone or tablet.

  

**Note:** This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Route Manager
description:
**Kept Companies** is the largest self-performing commercial cleaning and maintenance company in the nation. With nine leading brands and over 100 locations nationwide servicing industries including restaurant, solar, retail, transportation and supermarket. Kept Companies is the leading provider of commercial fleet washing, retail equipment refurbishing and sales, refrigeration, hood, coil and solar panel cleaning and parking lot services in the nation.

 **The Route Manager (RM)** is responsible for the safe and efficient completion of all available work for their assigned routes. Most days will consist of a mix of 30% office-related activities and 70% field-related activities. The route manager will engage in record keeping activities, scheduling, billing, jobsite quality and safety checks, and fleet and equipment maintenance management. This position requires a significant amount of driving from jobsite to jobsite. At times, the route manager may be required to engage in or work alongside crew members both for training and for assistance, and therefore must be willing to engage in washing and other manual labor activities. The route manager must possess some training in computer use and can learn Kept Companies operations software. Skills and experience in managing a dynamic work environment with many employees of varied skill levels is a must. There are no assigned work hours for this position, however time off is rarely available on weekends and is limited normally to two consecutive weekdays. The route manager must have the ability to self-manage within the workweek accomplishing many tasks and goals assigned. The route manager must be reachable by phone on all scheduled workdays.

  



Clean Driver’s License (Required)



Background Check (Required)



Bi-Lingual is a plus, but not mandatory.

  


**Key Responsibility Areas (KRA)**

  

* QUALITY CONTROL - Includes dispatching crews on time and with correct equipment, checking in with them while they are on the job to inspect work, answer any questions that may come up in the field, organizing and leading route team members in precise execution of services to achieve high customer satisfaction, make sure photos are uploaded into the portal.
* SAFETY AND ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE - Lead team and personally adhere to company standards for safety, environmental compliance, asset management, and procedural practices.
* OPERATIONAL EFFECIENCY - Completing 100% of assigned work in the most efficient manner possible while maintaining customer satisfaction, checking emails daily, discuss any changes to the schedule with operations manager, make sure all POs are entered into each job before reconciling, help keep labor under 37%, use optimize button on all routes being scheduled, make sure all phones are charged.
* SCHEDULING AND BILLING WORKFLOWS - Complete and validate schedule by Sunday, prior to the following week’s beginning, each day reconcile all work and routes from the prior day immediately after dispatch, each week must be completely billed and reconciled with all wages accounted for by 12PM Tuesday morning.

  


**Regular Duties**

  


* At the direction of the Operations Manager, a route manager may be asked to aid in hiring, promotion, discipline, and other HR related activities
* Overseeing all route level employees including onboard training, and day to day route activities.
* Respond to operational problems in the field including breakdowns, injuries or other issues as they arise.
* Ensure preparation of and regular service of all assigned vehicles and equipment.
* Correcting issues or complaints from customers.
* Responding to emergencies and special call in work from customers.
* Assist or lead monthly team safety meetings.
* Assist in the regular reviews, and counseling of all route employees.

  


**Compensation and Benefits**

  


* Route manager will receive a company cell phone and credit card for work related expenses.
* Route manager may participate in company health and vacation plans.
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance
* Life Insurance

title: Hood Cleaner Technician
description:
Immediate opening for **Kitchen Exhaust/Hood Cleaning Technicians** for commercial hood and duct cleaning business. We provide hood, duct, and vent cleaning to our customers. Experience is preferred but not required. We will train. **Must be a minimum of 21 years of age with a valid driver's license and clean driving record**.

  

Must be able to workdays, evenings, nights as needed. Valid and clean license required to drive our vehicles. Thorough background check and E-Verify will be completed.

 **Responsibilities and Duties**



The **Kitchen Exhaust/Hood Cleaner** position is responsible for cleaning *Kitchen Grease Exhaust Vent Systems,* kitchen equipment, and other items as requested. Driving company vans and vehicles to and from job sites. Set up and operation of various pressure washing equipment and chemical applications. Manual removal of heavier buildup with various hand scrapers and mechanical equipment. Document cleanings and deficiencies with digital cameras. Communicate with customers and other staff, plus various other duties as requested and needed.


* Power washing of kitchen exhausts systems including hoods, duct work, and fans.
* Set up and take down all jobsites and equipment. including wiping down stainless-steel hoods, setting up wet/dry vacuums, high pressure hoses, pre-sprayers, ladders, hanging plastic sheeting, etc.
* Independent completion of work projects without supervision.
* Maintain equipment, reporting any mechanical deficiencies.


**Requirements for Cleaning Technician:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent
* Must be a minimum of 21 years of age.
* Have a valid Driver's License with a clean driving record.
* Basic knowledge of hand and/or power tools.
* HVAC experience (preferred)
* Equipment repair and/or Mechanical knowledge (preferred)
* Must be dependable and reliable with the ability to show up on time.
* Ability to perform the essential job functions safely and successfully.
* Able to climb ladders.
* Able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. or more.
* Have excellent attention to detail and work fast and efficiently.
* Able to work flexible hours.
* Able to work in various weather conditions (ie. hot, cold, rain, etc.).
* Ability to work independently and carry out assignments given with minimal supervision.
* Have good verbal and written communication skills.
* Have the desire to learn quickly and be able to work in a fast-paced work environment with a growing company.


Looking to hire multiple positions immediately.



NOTE: This position does not require any specific skills such as appliance repair, mechanical knowledge, or HVAC expertise. It is primarily focused on general cleaning duties.

title: Concrete Laborer
description:
Summary:



Esposito Construction has dozens of major sitework projects underway across NJ and we’re looking for a competent Concrete Laborers to join the team in NJ. Experience in working on relevant projects is essential. If you are looking to join a growing company with room for advancement please apply today!

  

Benefits:

* Setting up, aligning, and securing forms to hold concrete during the pour, ensuring accuracy in dimensions.
